abstract: Merrill Lynch said Thursday that first-quarter profit rose 31 percent, to $2.16 billion, lifted by record investment-banking fees and trading revenue. Merrill’s chief executive, Stan O’Neal, called it a “terrific quarter” despite a sometimes volatile environment. Including Merrill’s latest figures, Bloomberg News reported that first-quarter profit at the five biggest securities firms in the nation totaled $9.7 billion, an all-time high. Separately, Bank of America said Thursday that first-quarter profit increased 5 percent to $5.26 billion, helped by growth in fee income.
